channel.title: Workshop fixes which might be good enough to be added to an upstream update
channel.description:
There are some nice and often very small but effective fixes available through the Steam Workshop which in my opinion are good enough to be added to an upstream update:
[url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=482087356']Tripmine Aquiring Sound Fix[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=470070900']No Sprint Sound - removes the sprint sound, which is very annoying with alyways sprint enabled. Another idea would be to disable this sound only when always sprinting is enabled.[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=487703152']Emergency Flare Texture Edit/Fix[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=493034539']Scientist Shirt Retexture[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=482285127']Weapons Sound Sync Fix[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=500659209']Hivehand Acquisition Fix (what many players have been waiting for a while)[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=500724252']Blast Pit Lighting Fix[/url] [url='https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=501700003']Lambda Core Teleport lighting fix[/url]

item.title: Workshop fixes which might be good enough to be added to an upstream update
item.dc:creator: djcj
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

These are (every single one) workarounds and not fixes. They do not address the base problems which cause these bugs. We will fix these bugs by actually fixing them, rather than working around them.

Well, at least the tripmine thing is actually a fix, since it’s just a problem with the sound being kinda confusing to many players.
It’s good to hear you’re aware of these issues and trying to fix them. :thumbup:
But at least for the hivehand issue I think a temporary workaround solution like the one from the workshop is still better than being forced to lookup some “hacky” give commands or to play the game without the hivehand at all.

Sage J. Fox:
TextFAMGUY1:

These are (every single one) workarounds and not fixes. They do not address the base problems which cause these bugs. We will fix these bugs by actually fixing them, rather than working around them.

To be fair, at least he didn’t post links to all the “original placement restored” mods that have overrun the workshop.

Why shoudl I have done that anyway?

Read full topic
item.source: Workshop fixes which might be good enough to be added to an upstream update

item.source: Workshop fixes which might be good enough to be added to an upstream update

item.title: Workshop fixes which might be good enough to be added to an upstream update
item.dc:creator: djcj
item.description:
There are some nice and often very small but effective fixes available through the Steam Workshop which in my opinion are good enough to be added to an upstream update:

Tripmine Aquiring Sound Fix
No Sprint Sound - removes the sprint sound, which is very annoying with alyways sprint enabled. Another idea would be to disable this sound only when always sprinting is enabled.
Emergency Flare Texture Edit/Fix
Scientist Shirt Retexture
Weapons Sound Sync Fix
Hivehand Acquisition Fix (what many players have been waiting for a while)
Blast Pit Lighting Fix
Lambda Core Teleport lighting fix

Read full topic
item.source: Workshop fixes which might be good enough to be added to an upstream update
